summary:
Stonehenge is an ancient monument in England, made of huge stones arranged in a circle. It was built in different stages over many years, starting around 3100 BC. The biggest stones, called sarsens, were put in place around 2500 BC. Smaller stones, called bluestones, were moved there too.

People believe it was used for burials and might have been a special place for watching the sun rise and set on important days. It's a famous landmark and a UNESCO World Heritage Site, showing us how our ancestors lived and believed.
title: Stonehenge
